required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Bimatoprost Sustained-Release (SR) in Patients With Open-Angle Glaucoma or Ocular Hypertension
clinical_study.official_title: The Efficacy and Safety of Bimatoprost SR in Patients With Open-angle Glaucoma or Ocular Hypertension

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the efficacy and safety of bimatoprost sustained-release (SR) in patients with open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension. The study includes a 12-month treatment period with an 8-month extended follow-up.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Intraocular Pressure (IOP) in the Study Eye

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in IOP in the Study Eye

arm_group.description: Study Eye: bimatoprost sustained-release (SR) Dose A administered on Day 1, Week 16, and Week 32; timolol vehicle administered once in the morning and once in the evening for up to 20 months. Non-Study Eye: sham administration on Day 1, Week 16, and Week 32; timolol administered once in the morning and once in the evening for up to 20 months.

Study Eye: bimatoprost SR Dose B administered on Day 1, Week 16, and Week 32; timolol vehicle administered once in the morning and once in the evening for up to 20 months. Non-Study Eye: sham administration on Day 1, Week 16, and Week 32; timolol administered once in the morning and once in the evening for up to 20 months.
Both Eyes: sham administered on Day 1, Week 16, and Week 32; timolol administered once in the morning and once in the evening for up to 20 months.

intervention.description: Bimatoprost sustained-release (SR) administered in the study eye on Day 1, Week 16, and Week 32.
Sham administered on Day 1, Week 16, and Week 32, as per protocol.
Timolol administered once in the morning and once in the evening for up to 20 months, as per protocol.
Timolol vehicle administered once in the morning and once in the evening for up to 20 months, as per protocol.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of either open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension in each eye and both eyes require IOP-lowering treatment.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous enrollment in another Allergan Bimatoprost SR Study
- Eye surgery (including cataract surgery) and/or any eye laser surgery within the past 6 months in the study eye
- Anticipated need for laser eye surgery within the first 52 weeks of the study duration
- History of glaucoma surgery
